DataElement.preferredName: Person Psychiatric Disorder Personal Medical History Ind-3
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no/unknown indicator that asks whether there was a history of psychiatric disturbance.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Person Psychiatric Disorder Personal Medical History
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the presence of any deviation from the normal structure or function of the brain and a psychiatric condition, that results in an impairment of an individual's normal cognitive, emotional, or behavioral functioning, and is caused by physiological or psychosocial factors.

Property.preferredDefinition: Psychiatric illness or diseases manifested by breakdowns in the adaptational process expressed primarily as abnormalities of thought, feeling, and behavior producing either distress or impairment of function.:an account of all medical events and problems a person has experienced.

Concepts.definition: A disorder characterized by behavioral and/or psychological abnormalities, often accompanied by physical symptoms. The symptoms may cause clinically significant distress or impairment in social and occupational areas of functioning. Representative examples include anxiety disorders, cognitive disorders, mood disorders and schizophrenia.
A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual. In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: patients' acknowledgement and acceptance of participation in a clinical trial.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/unknown.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/unknown.

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, or unknown.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.2.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Retired DBW 4-27-2016 per Tina Taylor approved by Dianne Reeves

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. 3/35/2016 jk removed "indeterminate" value that was added in error. 7/7/2021wz: added ALT VM name for HOPE-CARE project.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have uncontrolled psychiatric illness that would limit compliance with study requirements?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have serious medical or psychiatric illness likely to interfere with study participation?

ReferenceDocuments.name: PBTC_Text1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a documented history of or active major depressive episode, bipolar disorder (I or II), obsessive-compulsive disorder, schizophrenia, a history of suicidal attempt or ideation, or homicidal ideation, >= CTCAE grade 2 depression , >= CTCAE grade 2 anxiety?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the participant had any suicidal thoughts

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have untreated depression, Major Depressive Disorder (MDD), suicidal ideations or anxiety disorders in the past 5 years per the medical chart based on DSM IV diagnoses.

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG_CRF_TEXT_2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient currently have, or have a history of, grade 4 depression?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF TEXT 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have any serious medical or psychiatric illness/condition including substance use disorders likely in the judgment of the Investigator(s) to interfere or limit compliance with study requirements/treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have symptoms of or a history of schizophrenia, bipolar disease, and/or a major depression?

DataElement.origin: ECOG CRF:Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group Case Report Form
DataElement.changeDescription: Replaced VD Chronic Disease Ind-3 (2018845v1) with VD Yes No Unknown Indicator (3506034v1) - dbw
